metadata.Description: Biofuels are fuels produced from biomass, such as ethanol or biodiesel, that can be used as alternatives to fossil fuels.

level 1.Description: Biofuels are implemented as part of the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.
Investment in biofuels is funded by the Research and Development department to support the development of sustainable energy solutions.
The use of biofuels focuses on reducing carbon emissions and mitigating the impact of fossil fuels on climate change.
Biofuels are used as an alternative fuel source in the transportation sector to reduce reliance on fossil fuels.
Biofuel producers partner with renewable energy companies to enhance the production and distribution of biofuels.
The use of biofuels contributes to energy security by diversifying the energy sources and reducing dependence on imported fossil fuels.
The environmental impact of biofuels is monitored to ensure sustainable production and minimize negative effects on ecosystems.
Biofuels are targeted to contribute to the achievement of renewable energy goals and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy democracy
level 2.Description: Energy democracy addresses energy inequality by promoting equitable access to clean and affordable energy for all individuals and communities.

level 2.Subject: energy democracy
level 2.Description: Energy democracy employs participatory decision-making processes to ensure that all stakeholders have a voice in shaping energy policies and projects.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
